Tasks.Task Description: Gather detailed requirements for storage capacity, performance, and latency. Identify the applications and workloads that will use Azure HPC Cache.
Design the cache architecture, including the placement of cache clusters, integration with existing storage systems, and network topology.
Choose the appropriate cache tier and configuration based on workload requirements and budget constraints.
Create and configure the Azure HPC Cache instance in the Azure portal or using Azure CLI/PowerShell.
Connect the HPC Cache to the required storage systems, such as Azure Blob Storage or on-premises NAS systems.
Enable required security measures, such as encryption for data in transit and at rest. Configure access control policies and ensure compliance with organizational security standards.
Perform thorough testing of the cache performance, including throughput, latency, and failover scenarios to ensure it meets the required specifications.
Set up monitoring and alerting using Azure Monitor and other tools. Configure alerts for cache performance, capacity thresholds, and error conditions.
Document the cache architecture, configurations, and operational procedures. Provide training for the operations team on managing and troubleshooting the setup.
Ensure the cache setup meets all regulatory compliance requirements. Implement regular auditing procedures to verify compliance and security postures.
